title: Authors and Citation
text: Yaseen M, Ullah S (2024). gvcR: Genotypic Variance Components. R package version 0.3.0https://myaseen208.com/gvcR/ https://github.com/MYaseen208/gvcR, https://myaseen208.com/gvcR/     https://github.com/MYaseen208/gvcR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gvcR: Genotypic Variance Components},   author = {Muhammad Yaseen and Sami Ullah},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.3.0https://myaseen208.com/gvcR/      https://github.com/MYaseen208/gvcR},   url = {https://myaseen208.com/gvcR/      https://github.com/MYaseen208/gvcR}, }

title: gvcR
text: gvcR contains functions calculate Genotypic Variance, Phenotypic Variance Heritability.

title: gvcR
text: Use devtools install development version Github: {r} (!require("devtools")) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github('myaseen208/gvcR', build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: gvcR
text: package free open source software, licensed GPL.

title: Genotypic Variance — gvc
text: `gvc` class calculates genotypic variance, phenotypic variance, broad-sense heritability replicated data.

title: Genotypic Variance — gvc
text: `gvc` class uses methods explained Burton, G. W. & Devane, E. H. (1953) Allard, R.W. (2010). includes methods calculating genetic variance, phenotypic variance, heritability.

title: Genotypic Variance — gvc
text: data `tibble` containing data analysis. y name response variable. x name covariate (optional). rep name replicate factor. gen name genotype factor. env name environmental factor.

title: Genotypic Variance — gvc
text: .data `data.frame` containing data analysis. .y response variable. .x covariate (optional). .rep replicate factor. .gen genotype factor. .env environmental factor.

title: Genotypic Variance — gvc
code: df1 <- data.frame(            Response = c(                           rnorm(48, mean = 15000, sd = 500)                         , rnorm(48, mean =  5000, sd = 500)                         , rnorm(48, mean =  1000, sd = 500)                        )         , Rep      = as.factor(rep(1:3, each = 48))         , Variety  = gl(n = 4, k =  4, length = 144, labels = letters[1:4])         , Env      = gl(n = 3, k = 16, length = 144, labels = letters[1:3])         )  # Create an instance of the class gvc1 <- gvc$new(            .data = df1          , .y    = Response          , .rep  = Rep          , .gen  = Variety          , .env  = Env          )  # Calculate genetic variance (gvar) gvc1$calculate_gvar() #> boundary (singular) fit: see help('isSingular') #> $gvar #> [1] 1.392268e-11 #>   # Calculate phenotypic variance (pvar) gvc1$calculate_pvar() #> boundary (singular) fit: see help('isSingular') #> $pvar #> [1] 319911.6 #>   # Calculate heritability (h2) gvc1$calculate_herit() #> boundary (singular) fit: see help('isSingular') #> $h2 #> [1] 4.35204e-17 #>

title: Genotypic Variance Components — gvcR
text: Functionalities compute model based genetic components .e genotypic, phenotypic variances heritability given traits different genotypes replicated data using methodology  explained Burton, G. W. & Devane, E. H. (1953) (<doi:10.2134/agronj1953.00021962004500100005x>) Allard, R.W. (2010, ISBN:8126524154).

title: Genotypic Variance Components — gvcR
text: R.K. Singh B.D.Chaudhary          Biometrical Methods Quantitative Genetic Analysis.                Kalyani Publishers, New Delhi Williams, E.R., Matheson, .C. Harwood, C.E. (2002).Experimental Design Analysis Tree Improvement.                CSIRO Publishing.
